content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I attempted to execute a command to check the weather using the "curl wttr.in" command, but it failed due to too much output. I was then asked to execute a Python code to calculate the distance and travel time to a hiking trail using Google Maps API. However, the command returned an error due to a missing argument.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_file", "args": {"filename": "calculate_distance.py"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_python_file returned: python: can't open file '/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/calculate_distance.py': [Errno 2] No such file or directory", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "calculate_distance.py", "text": "import googlemaps\\nfrom datetime import datetime\\n\\n# Enter your API key here\\ngmaps = googlemaps.Client(key=\'YOUR_API_KEY\')\\n\\n# Define the addresses\\norigin = \'YOUR_ADDRESS\'\\ndestination = \'DESTINATION_ADDRESS\'\\n\\n# Define the departure time\\nnow = datetime.now()\\n\\n# Calculate the distance and travel time\\nresult = gmaps.directions(origin, destination, mode=\\"driving\\", departure_time=now)\\ndistance = result[0][\'legs\'][0][\'distance\'][\'text\']\\ntravel_time = result[0][\'legs\'][0][\'duration\'][\'text\']\\n\\nprint(\\"The distance to the hiking trail is:\\", distance)\\nprint(\\"The travel time to the hiking trail is:\\", travel_time)"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.', type='action_result')]
"""
